description: Commands to manage apps in Azure Spring Cloud.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app append-loaded-public-certificate
commands.summary: Append a new loaded public certificate to an app in the Azure Spring Cloud.
examples: az spring-cloud app append-loaded-public-certificate --name MyApp --service MyCluster --resource-group MyResourceGroup --certificate-name MyCertName --load-trust-store true

commands.name: az spring-cloud app append-persistent-storage
commands.summary: Append a new persistent storage to an app in the Azure Spring Cloud.
examples: az spring-cloud app append-persistent-storage --persistent-storage-type AzureFileVolume --share-name MyShareName --mount-path /MyMountPath --storage-name MyStorageName -n MyApp -g MyResourceGroup -s MyService

commands.name: az spring-cloud app create
commands.summary: Create a new app with a default deployment in the Azure Spring Cloud.
commands.syntax:
az spring-cloud app create --name
                           --resource-group
                           --service
                           [--assign-endpoint {false, true}]
                           [--cpu]
                           [--disable-probe {false, true}]
                           [--enable-persistent-storage {false, true}]
                           [--env]
                           [--instance-count]
                           [--jvm-options]
                           [--loaded-public-certificate-file]
                           [--memory]
                           [--persistent-storage]
                           [--runtime-version {Java_11, Java_17, Java_8, NetCore_31}]
                           [--system-assigned {false, true}]
                           [--user-assigned]
examples: az spring-cloud app create -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup
az spring-cloud app create -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --assign-endpoint true --cpu 2 --memory 3 --instance-count 3

commands.name: az spring-cloud app delete
commands.summary: Delete an app in the Azure Spring Cloud.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app deploy
commands.summary: Deploy source code or pre-built binary to an app and update related configurations.
commands.syntax:
az spring-cloud app deploy --name
                           --resource-group
                           --service
                           [--artifact-path]
                           [--build-env]
                           [--builder]
                           [--config-file-patterns]
                           [--container-args]
                           [--container-command]
                           [--container-image]
                           [--container-registry]
                           [--deployment]
                           [--disable-probe {false, true}]
                           [--disable-validation {false, true}]
                           [--env]
                           [--jvm-options]
                           [--main-entry]
                           [--no-wait]
                           [--registry-password]
                           [--registry-username]
                           [--runtime-version {Java_11, Java_17, Java_8, NetCore_31}]
                           [--source-path]
                           [--target-module]
                           [--version]
examples: az spring-cloud app deploy -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup
az spring-cloud app deploy -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --jar-path app.jar --jvm-options="-XX:+UseG1GC -XX:+UseStringDeduplication" --env foo=bar
az spring-cloud app deploy -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup -d green-deployment
az spring-cloud app deploy -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --container-image contoso/your-app:v1

az spring-cloud app deploy -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --container-image contoso/your-app:v1 --container-registry myacr.azurecr.io --registry-username <username> --registry-password <password>
az spring-cloud app deploy -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --config-file-patterns MyPatterns --jar-path app.jar

commands.name: az spring-cloud app list
commands.summary: List all apps in the Azure Spring Cloud.
examples: az spring-cloud app list -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup -o json --query '[].{Name:name, PersistentStorage:properties.persistentDisk}'

commands.name: az spring-cloud app logs
commands.summary: Show logs of an app instance, logs will be streamed when setting '-f/--follow'.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app restart
commands.summary: Restart instances of the app, default to production deployment.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app scale
commands.summary: Manually scale an app or its deployments.
examples: az spring-cloud app scale -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --cpu 3 --memory 8
az spring-cloud app scale -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup -d green-deployment --instance-count 5

commands.name: az spring-cloud app set-deployment
commands.summary: Set production deployment of an app.
examples: az spring-cloud app set-deployment -d green-deployment -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az spring-cloud app show
commands.summary: Show the details of an app in the Azure Spring Cloud.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app show-deploy-log
commands.summary: Show build log of the last deploy, only apply to source code deploy, default to production deployment.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app start
commands.summary: Start instances of the app, default to production deployment.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app stop
commands.summary: Stop instances of the app, default to production deployment.

commands.name: az spring-cloud app unset-deployment
commands.summary: Unset production deployment of an app.
examples: az spring-cloud app unset-deployment -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup

commands.name: az spring-cloud app update
commands.syntax:
az spring-cloud app update --name
                           --resource-group
                           --service
                           [--assign-endpoint {false, true}]
                           [--config-file-patterns]
                           [--deployment]
                           [--disable-probe {false, true}]
                           [--enable-ingress-to-app-tls {false, true}]
                           [--enable-persistent-storage {false, true}]
                           [--env]
                           [--https-only {false, true}]
                           [--jvm-options]
                           [--loaded-public-certificate-file]
                           [--main-entry]
                           [--no-wait]
                           [--persistent-storage]
                           [--runtime-version {Java_11, Java_17, Java_8, NetCore_31}]
examples: az spring-cloud app update -n MyApp -s MyCluster -g MyResourceGroup --env foo=bar
